New Records: Shreyas Iyer scored the fastest World Cup century by an India batter (62 balls)
India's top four batters reached fifty-plus in an innings of a Cricket World Cup encounter
Key Match Events: Shubman Gill was dismissed by Teja Nidamanuru with an excellent catch
Virat Kohli struck with his medium pace in the 25th over
Rohit Sharma dismissed Teja Nidamanuru with his off-spin
Kuldeep Yadav trapped Colin Ackermann leg before wicket
Ravindra Jadeja struck off his very first ball
Virat Kohli accounted for the Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards
Rohit Sharma brought in Virat Kohli to rest his mainstream bowlers and the star batter managed to strike with the ball
Pre-Game Insights: India openers were off to a characteristic aggressive start on a decent batting track in Bengaluru
India tried out a number of part-time options against Netherlands
Post-Match Reflections: India's top five batters all scored in excess of fifty
India's batters found it tough to get away from Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja
The Netherlands batters appeared clueless before the slow left-arm unorthodox spin of Kuldeep and found it tough to get away from him
Miscellaneous Highlights: Particularly impressive was Shubman Gill's six-hitting prowess
Teja Nidamanuru sent back Shubman Gill with an excellent catch
de Leede became the most successful Dutch bowler in the Cricket World Cup with 15 scalps
Others: India were helped to their highest score of the tournament by their batters before the bowlers did a clinical job in the second innings
The Netherlands started positively despite the overwhelming target of 411 that had been set by India
India's batting lineup showed resilience and consistency
The Netherlands put up a spirited display with the bat, but never quite came close to overhauling the mammoth target
